org.strongback.components

Interface Gyroscope

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AngleSensor, Compass, Zeroable

    @ThreadSafe
public interface Gyroscope
extends Compass
    A gyroscope is a device that measures angular velocity (in degrees per second) about a single axis. A gyroscope can indirectly determine angular displacement by integrating velocity with respect to time, which is why it extends Compass. Negative values are assumed to be counter-clockwise and positive values are clockwise.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Gyroscope create(DoubleSupplier angleSupplier, DoubleSupplier rateSupplier)
      Create a gyroscope for the given functions that returns the angular displacement and velocity.
      double getRate()
      Gets the rate of change in AngleSensor.getAngle() of this Gyroscope in degrees per second.
      default Gyroscope zero()
      Change the output so that the current angle is considered to be 0.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.strongback.components.Compass

        computeHeadingChangeTo, create, getHeading

      • Methods inherited from interface org.strongback.components.AngleSensor

        computeAngleChangeTo, getAngle, invert

        Create a gyroscope for the given functions that returns the angular displacement and velocity.
        Parameters:
